alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 05 at 9:24AM CST until March 06 at 3:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Slushy Snow Moves In Tonight... .Wet, slushy snow will develop this evening with the highest impact period expected from this evening into early Monday morning. Snowfall rates in excess of an inch an hour will be possible for a few hours resulting in quick accumulations on roads and slick, difficult travel. Light mixed precipitation could persist into Monday along with gusty winds. Although most of the accumulation snow will be done by sunrise, some travel impacts for the Monday morning commute are possible. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 PM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Taylor and Clark Counties. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 3 PM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
